ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] assumes that the client has previously established a Session Context with the server, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] and [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP].

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] Once that connection is made, the client is then able to follow the protocol specified in this document to establish a logon session with a private mailbox, or the public folders.

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] After the logon session is established, the client follows the protocol specified in this document to perform various operations on the user mailbox and make discoveries about where public folder content is located.

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] All ROPs described in [MS-OXCROPS], except the RopLogon ROP (section 2.2.1.1), are performed with the assumption that the client has successfully logged on to the server using RopLogon ROP.

[In Transport] The ROP request buffers specified by this protocol are sent to and received from the server by using the underlying Remote Operations (ROP) List and Encoding Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCROPS].

[In Transport] The ROP response buffers specified by this protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] are received from the server by using the underlying Remote Operations (ROP) List and Encoding Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In Message Syntax] Unless otherwise specified, unit sizes in the following sections are expressed in bytes.
[In Remote Operations] The following sections specify the ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers that are specific to the Store Object protocol.
[In RopLogon ROP] The RopLogon ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1) establishes a logon session between the client and the server.
[In RopLogon ROP] It [RopLogon] is the basis of all further ROPs, and successfully completing a RopLogon ROP is a prerequisite for performing all other ROPs listed in this specification.
[In RopLogon ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopLogon ROP] The following sections specify the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags: This field contains flags that control the behavior of the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags: Individual flag values and their meanings are specified in the following table.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags: The client MUST NOT set any unspecified flags [not in one of there Flags: Private,Undercover, Ghosted].
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The value of the flag Private: 0x01.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The description of the flag Private: This flag is set for logon to a private mailbox and is not set for logon to public folders.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The value of the flag Undercover: 0x02.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The description of flag Undercover: This flag is ignored by the server.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The value of the flag Ghosted: 0x04.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The description of flag Ghosted: This flag is ignored by the server.<1>
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] The value of the flag SpoolerProcess: 0x08.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [LogonFlags] This flag is ignored by the server.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags: This field contains additional flags that control the behavior of the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags: Individual flag values and their meanings are specified in the following table [the table under the OpenFlags property in section 2.2.1.1.1].
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags: The client MUST NOT set any unspecified flags.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag USE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE: 0x00000001.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag USE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE: A request for administrative access to the mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag PUBLIC: 0x00000002.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag PUBLIC: A request to open a public folders message store.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag PUBLIC: This flag MUST be set for public logons.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag HOME_LOGON: 0x00000004.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag HOME_LOGON: This flag is ignored.<2>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCSTOR_R7900.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag TAKE_OWNERSHIP: 0x00000008.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag TAKE_OWNERSHIP: This flag is ignored.<3>
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag ALTERNATE_SERVER: 0x00000100.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag ALTERNATE_SERVER: Requests a private server to provide an alternate public server.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag IGNORE_HOME_MDB: 0x00000200.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag IGNORE_HOME_MDB: This flag is used only for public logons.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag IGNORE_HOME_MDB: When set, this flag allows the client to log on to a public message store that is not the user's default public message store.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag IGNORE_HOME_MDB: Otherwise [when not set], [the client] attempts to log on to a public message store that is not the user's default results in the client being redirected back to the user's default public message store.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag NO_MAIL: 0x00000400.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag NO_MAIL: A request for a nonmessaging logon session.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag NO_MAIL: A request for a nonmessaging sessions allow clients to access the message store.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag NO_MAIL: Nonmessaging sessions do not allow messages to be sent or received.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING: 0x01000000.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING: For a private-mailbox logon. This flag SHOULD<4> be set.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING: For logons to a public folder message store, this flag is ignored.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCSTOR_R3540.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING: For logons to a public folder message store, the server reply is the same, no matter whether the flag is set or not.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The value of flag SUPPORT_PROGRESS: 0x20000000.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] [OpenFlags] The description of flag SUPPORT_PROGRESS: Indicates that the client supports asynchronous processing of RopSetReadFlags, as specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.10.1.<5>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCMSG_R1513.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] EssdnSize: This field contains the size, in bytes, of the Essdn field.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: In the case of a private mailbox logon, this field contains an ASCII string that uniquely identifies a mailbox to log on to.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: In the case of a public folder logon, this field SHOULD<6> contain an ASCII string that uniquely identifies the server that contains the public folder mailbox to log on to.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R1266001, MS-OXCSTOR_R1266002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: The string value contained in the Essdn field includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: The string length (including the terminating NULL character) MUST be equal to the value specified by the EssdnSize field.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: If the value of the EssdnSize field is 0x00, the Essdn field is empty.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: In a private mailbox logon, the string to be used in this field is the value of the legacy distinguished name (DN) attribute of the user object that is obtained by using the Autodiscover Publishing and Lookup Protocol, as specified in [MS-OXDSCLI].

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn: In a public folder logon, the string to be used in this field is the value of the legacy DN attribute for the public folder mailbox that is obtained by either using the Autodiscover Publishing and Lookup Protocol or from the response of the RopGetOwningServers ROP (section 2.2.1.6), the RopOpenFolder ROP ([MS-OXCFOLD] section 2.2.1.1), or the RopCreateFolder ROP ([MS-OXCFOLD] section 2.2.1.2), which all return the legacy DN of the mailbox containing the public folders contents.

[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [LogonFlags, ServerName] for the redirect response buffer of the RopLogon ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1.4), when the value of the ReturnValue field is 0x00000478 (ecWrongServer).
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlags: This field contains the Private, Undercover, and Ghosted flags.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlags: The server returns these flags unchanged from the LogonFlags field of the RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlag: The client MUST ignore all other flags [except the flag Private, Undercover and Ghosted].

[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName: This field contains the enterprise/site/server distinguished name (ESSDN) of server for the client to connect to, as the server included in the request no longer hosts the requested mailbox (it was moved), or was the wrong server to connect to for access to public folders.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName: The string includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName: The string length (including the terminating NULL character) MUST be equal to the value specified by the ServerNameSize field.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] The following descriptions define valid fields [LogonFlags, FolderIds, Response Flags, ReplId, ReplGuid, Logon Time, GwartTime, and StoreState] for the success response buffer for private folders of the ROPLogon ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1.2).

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] The following field values [LogonFlags, FolderIds, Response Flags, ReplId, ReplGuid, Logon Time, GwartTime, StoreState] are included in the RopLogon response only when the Private bit is set in the LogonFlags field of the RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] LogonFlags: This field is composed of the Private, Undercover, and Ghosted flags.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] LogonFlags: The server returns these flags [Private, Undercover, and Ghostedflags] unchanged from the LogonFlags field of the RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] LogonFlags: The client MUST ignore all other flags [except the flag Private, Undercover and Ghosted].

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] FolderIds: This field identifies the folder ID (FID) ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) of all of the following folders: Mailbox Root folder(All other folders listed here are direct or indirect children of this folder) ,Deferred Action, Spooler Queue, Interpersonal Messages Subtree (Root folder of the user-visible portion of the folder hierarchy), Inbox, Outbox, Sent Items, Deleted Items, Common Views, Schedule, Search, Views, Shortcuts.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] Response Flags: This field contains flags that provide details about the state of the mailbox.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R123, MS-OXCSTOR_R125, MS-OXCSTOR_R127, MS-OXCSTOR_R129.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] Response Flags: Individual flag values [0x01 (Reserved), 0x02 (OwnerRight), 0x04 (SendAsRight), 0x10 (OOF)] and their meanings are specified in the following table.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The value of flag Reserved: 0x01.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The description of flag Reserved: This bit [Reserved] MUST be set.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The description of flag Reserved: This bit MUST be ignored by the client.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The value of flag OwnerRight: 0x02.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The description of flag OwnerRight: The user has owner permission on the mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The value of flag SendAsRight: 0x04.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The description of flag SendAsRight: The user has the right to send mail from the mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] [Response Flags] The value of flag OOF: 0x10.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] The description of flag OOF: The Out of Office (OOF) state is set on the mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] The description of flag OOF: For details about the OOF state, see [MS-OXWOOF].
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] ReplId: This field contains the short form of the value specified in the REPLGUID field, which is the replica ID for the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] ReplGuid: This field contains the GUID used to identify the source of the REPLID to REPLGUID mapping and named property mappings.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] ReplGuid: If the client did not set the USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING bit in the OpenFlags field, this value MUST be identical for all private mailbox logons on the same remote procedure call (RPC) session.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] LogonTime: This field contains the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time on the server when the logon was performed.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] LogonTime: For more details about the format of this field see [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1.2.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: This field contains a numeric value that tracks the currency of the Gateway Address Routing Table (GWART).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: This value is unique for each update of the GWART.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: The client can use the value of the GwartTime field to determine whether the client's address type configuration data is current.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: If the most recent value of GwartTime matches the one that was returned on the previous logon to the mailbox, the client's address-type configuration data is up-to-date.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: The client only uses the value of GwartTime in a comparison to detect a change.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] GwartTime: It [the client] does not interpret the value of GwartTime in any way.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] StoreState: This field is unused.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] StoreState: This field MUST be set to 0x00000000 by the server. <7>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R59781, MS-OXCSTOR_R1410001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailbox] StoreState: MUST be ignored by the client.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] The following descriptions define valid fields [LogonFlags, FolderIds] for the success response buffer for public folders of the ROPLogon ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.1.3).

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] The success response buffer for public folders is sent only when the Private bit is not set in the LogonFlags field of the RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags: This field [LogonFlags] is composed of the Private, Undercover, and Ghosted flags.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags: The server returns these flags [Private, Undercover, and Ghosted] unchanged from the LogonFlags field of the RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags: The client MUST ignore all other flags [except Private, Undercover, and Ghosted].
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] FolderIds: This field contains 13 64-bit Folder ID structures, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCSTOR_R119.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] FolderIds: This field contains the Folder ID of the following folders: <8> Public Folders Root Folder (All other folders listed here are direct or indirect children of this folder), Interpersonal messages subtree, Non-interpersonal messages subtree, EForms Registry, Free/Busy Data, Offline address book Data, EForms Registry for the user's locale, Local Site's Free/Busy Data, Local Site's Offline Address, Book Data, NNTP Article Index, Empty, Empty, Empty.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R155, MS-OXCSTOR_R5979301.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplId: This field [ReplId] contains the short form of the value specified in the ReplGuid field.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplGuid: This field [ReplGuid] contains the GUID used to identify the origin of ID and named property mappings.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplGuid: This value [ReplGuid] is randomly assigned to a database when it is created.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplGuid: This value [ReplGuid] is an integral part of all IDs assigned in the database.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplGuid: It [ReplGuid] is used in forming LongTermIDs structures, as defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] PerUserGuid: This field [PerUserGuid] is not used.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] PerUserGuid: This field [PerUserGuid] is ignored by the client.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] PerUserGuid: The server SHOULD set this field to an empty GUID (all zeroes).<9>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R163, MS-OXCSTOR_R1332.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] The RopGetReceiveFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.2) is used to determine the Receive folder for messages of a specific message class.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] This ROP [RopGetReceiveFolder] examines the message class string and returns the folder ID (FID) ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) of the Receive folder to which messages of that class and all subclasses are delivered.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] This ROP [RopGetReceiveFolder] also returns the specific parent message class configured to deliver to that folder.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [2.2.1.2.1] define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP request buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.2.1).
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] This operation [RopGetReceiveFolder] is only valid when the Logon object refers to a private mailbox logon.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: This field contains a string that specifies the message class.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: Examination of the string [Contained by MessageClass] is case-insensitive.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string uses ASCII encoding.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The length (including the terminating NULL character) is greater than zero and less than or equal to 255.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: Each character value in the string is in the numeric range of 32 to 126, inclusive.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not begin with a period (".").
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not end with a period.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [Contained by MessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not contain adjacent periods.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions [2.2.1.2.2] define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP success response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.2.2).

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] FolderId: This field [FolderId] contains the Folder Id, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1, of the folder to which messages are being delivered.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] FolderId: The folder MUST be a folder within the user's mailbox.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: This field [ExplicitMessageClass] contains a string specifying the message class that is actually configured for the Receive folder.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The case of the characters in the string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] is insignificant.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string uses ASCII encoding.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The length (including the terminating NULL character) is greater than zero and less than or equal to 255.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: Each character value in the string is in the numeric range of 32 to 126, inclusive.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not begin with a period (".").
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not end with a period.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass: The string [Contained by ExplicitMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirement: The string does not contain adjacent periods.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.4.1.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] RopSetReceiveFolder is used to establish the Receive folder for messages of a given message class.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] As a result, all messages of the specified message class will be delivered to the folder identified by the specified FID, as defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] Multiple message classes are permitted to be registered to the same Receive folder.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] A client can change an existing Receive folder configuration for a message class by simply issuing this ROP with a different value in the FolderId field.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] This section [2.2.1.3] specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] This operation [RopSetReceiveFolder] MUST be issued against a private mailbox logon.

[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [FolderId, MessageClass] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopSetReceiveFolder ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.3.1).
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: Contains the FID of the desired Receive folder for the message class and all nonspecifically configured subclasses of that class.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: It [MessageClass] Contains the string identifying the message class whose delivery folder is being set.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: The string uses ASCII encoding.

[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: The length (including the terminating NULL character) is greater than zero and less than or equal to 255.

[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: Each character value in the string is in the numeric range of 32 to 126, inclusive.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: The string does not begin with a period (".").
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: The string does not end with a period.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass: The string [MessageClass] MUST comply with all of the following restrictions: The string does not contain adjacent periods.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopSetReceiveFolder ROP response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.3.2.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopSetReceiveFolder ROP response buffer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP] The RopGetReceiveFolderTable is used to obtain a comprehensive list of all configured message classes and their associated Receive folders.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Request Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP request buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.4.1.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Request Buffer] There are no explicit fields for this operation [RopGetReceiveFolderTable].
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Request Buffer] The data to retrieve is limited to the mailbox linked to the Logon object passed as part of the normal ROP request process.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Request Buffer] This operation [RopGetReceiveFolderTable] MUST be issued against a private mailbox logon.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP success response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.4.2).
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] RowCount: The number of rows in the table.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] RowCount: The rows themselves can be returned in any order.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] Rows: An array that contains the rows of the Receive folder table.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] Rows: Each row is returned in either a StandardPropertyRow structure or a FlaggedPropertyRow structure, both of which [StandardPropertyRow, FlaggedPropertyRow] are specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.8.1.1 and [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.8.1.2, respectively.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] Rows: The value of each structure's [StandardPropertyRow structure, FlaggedPropertyRow] Flag field indicates which structure is being used: 0x00 for the StandardPropertyRow structure.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] Rows: The value of each structure's [StandardPropertyRow structure, FlaggedPropertyRow] Flag field indicates which structure is being used: 0x01 for the FlaggedPropertyRow structure.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] Rows: The ValueArray field of either StandardPropertyRow or FlaggedPropertyRow MUST include only the following properties[PidTagFolderId property, PidTagMessageClass property, PidTagLastModificationTime property], in the order given, and no other properties.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagFolderId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.691): A PtypInteger64 value that specifies the folder ID (FID) ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1) of the Receive folder, which is the folder to which messages of the specified message class will be delivered.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagFolderId property: The Receive folder MUST be a folder that is within the user's mailbox.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.778): A PtypString8 value.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows]PidTagMessageClass property: It [PidTagMessageClass] specifies the message class that is configured for the Receive folder.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass property] can be all upper case, all lower case, or as originally stored by the client.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] includes the terminating NULL character.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: The string uses ASCII encoding.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: The length (including the terminating NULL character) is greater than zero and less than or equal to 255.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: Each character value in the string is in the numeric range of 32 to 126, inclusive.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: The string does not begin with a period (".").

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: The string does not end with a period.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagMessageClass property: The string [PidTagMessageClass] MUST meet the following requirements: The string does not contain adjacent periods.

[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Success Response Buffer] [Rows] PidTagLastModificationTime property: PidTagLastModificationTime property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.755) -- A PtypTime value that specifies the time, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), when the server created or last modified the row in the Receive folder table.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.4.1.
[In RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopGetReceiveFolderTable ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP] The RopGetStoreState ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.5) is used to obtain state information about the current mailbox.<10>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R3125, MS-OXCSTOR_R3126.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetStoreState ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetStoreState ROP] This section [2.2.1.5] specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Request Buffer] There are no explicit fields for this operation [RopGetStoreState].

[In RopGetStoreState ROP Request Buffer] The data to be retrieved is limited to the mailbox that is linked to the LogonID that is passed as part of the ROP request, as specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.5.1.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Request Buffer] This operation [RopGetStoreState] MUST be issued against a private mailbox logon.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions [StorState] define valid fields for the RopGetStoreState ROP success response buffer ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.5.2).
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Success Response Buffer] StoreState: If the mailbox currently has any active search folders, this field [StoreState] MUST have the STORE_HAS_SEARCHES flag (0x01000000) set.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Success Response Buffer] StoreState: If the STORE_HAS_SEARCHES flag is set, the user has created one or more active searches in the message store.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Success Response Buffer] StoreState: All other bits [all bits except STORE_HAS_SEARCHES ] MUST NOT be set.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetStoreState ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.5.3.
[In RopGetStoreState ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopGetStoreState ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP] RopGetOwningServers is used to obtain the set of servers that host content for a replicated public folder.

[In RopGetOwningServers ROP] This ROP is useful for a situation in which the client issues a ROP that reads content from a public folder on a specific server (RopGetContentsTable ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.4.14), RopOpenMessage ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.1), and RopCreateMessage ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.6.2) are such ROPs), and the server that receives the request does not contain a replica, resulting in a failure of the ROP with ecNoReplicaHere (0x00000468).
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP] The client can issue a RopGetOwningServers ROP request to obtain the set of servers that do contain a replica.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP] This section [2.2.1.6] specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Request Buffer] This operation [RopGetOwningServers] SHOULD be issued against a public folders logon.<11>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCSTOR_R3490001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopGetOwningServers ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [FolderId] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetOwningServers ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.6.2).
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: Contains the FID of the public folder for which to obtain the replica set server names.

[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions [OwningServersCount, CheapServersCount, OwningServers] define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopGetOwningServers ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.6.2).
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] OwningServersCount: Identifies the number of strings contained in the OwningServers field.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: Identifies the number of entries at the front of the list that have the same lowest network cost.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This value [CheapServersCount] MUST be less than or equal to OwningServersCount.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This value [CheapServersCount] MUST be greater than zero if OwningServersCount is greater than zero.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] OwningServers: Contains an array of null-terminated ASCII strings.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] OwningServers: Each string is the ESSDN of a public folder database that hosts an active replica of the content of the folder.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] OwningServers: The number of strings MUST be equal to the value specified in the OwningServersCount field.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Success Response Buffer] OwningServers: The entries are sorted by the server's interpretation of the network cost for each entry in the list.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetOwningServers ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.6.3.
[In RopGetOwningServers ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopGetOwningServers ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP] The RopPublicFolderIsGhosted is used to obtain the replication state for a folder on the current server.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP] Folders can exist in one of several replica states, but all states except the Active state are implementation-specific.<12>
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Request Buffer] This operation SHOULD only be issued against a public folders logon.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCSTOR_R400001.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [FolderID] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.7).
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: Contains the FID of the public folder for which to obtain the ghosted state.

[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions [ISGhosted, ServersCount, CheapServersCount, Servers] define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.7).
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] otherwise [if the server is an active replica of the folder the IsGhosted flag] is FALSE.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: This field[Servers] is not present if the IsGhosted field is set to FALSE
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: This field is not present if the IsGhosted field is set to FALSE.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] IsGhosted: Contains a Boolean value that is TRUE when the server is not an active replica of the public folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] IsGhosted: Other fields [ServersCount, CheapServersCount, and CheapServersCount] are included in the response only when the IsGhosted field is set to TRUE.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] ServersCount: Identifies the number of strings contained in the Servers field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] ServersCount: This field [ ServersCount] is present if the IsGhosted field is set to TRUE
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] ServersCount: This field [ServersCount] is not present if the IsGhosted field is set to FALSE.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: Identifies the number of entries at the front of the list that have the same lowest network cost.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This value [CheapServersCount] MUST be less than or equal to ServersCount.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This value [CheapServersCount] MUST be greater than zero if ServersCount is greater than zero.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This field[CheapServersCount] is present if the IsGhosted field is set to TRUE
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] CheapServersCount: This field [CheapServersCount] is not present if the IsGhosted field is set to FALSE.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: Contains an array of null-terminated ASCII strings.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: Each string is the ESSDN of a public folder database that itself hosts an active replica of the content of the folder.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: The number of strings MUST be equal to the value specified in the ServersCount field.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: The entries are sorted by the server's interpretation of the network cost for each entry in the list.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Success Response Buffer] Servers: This field is present if the IsGhosted field is set to TRUE.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R307, MS-OXCROPS_R312 and MS-OXCROPS_R316.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.7.3.
[In RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol adds no additional field information to the RopPublicFolderIsGhosted ROP failure response buffer.

[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP] The RopLongTermIdFromId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.8) is used to obtain a LongTermID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1, given a Folder ID structure or Message ID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.1 or section 2.2.1.2.
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopLongTermIdFromId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.8.1).

[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Request Buffer] ObjectId: Contains the Folder ID structure or Message ID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.1.1 or 2.2.1.2, that is mapped to a LongTermID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Request Buffer] The Folder ID or Message ID is a 64-bit value composed of a 16-bit replica ID (REPLID) followed by a 48-bit global counter.
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Request Buffer] ObjectId: The 16-bit REPLID portion of the Folder ID or Message ID MUST be a valid entry in the REPLID and REPLGUID to-and-from mapping table.

[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions [LongTermId] define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopLongTermIdFromId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.8)
[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Success Response Buffer] LongTermId: Contains the LongTermID structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.

[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Success Response Buffer] That [LongTermId] is mapped from the given Folder ID as specified in[MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.4.1 or 2.2.4.2, that is contained in the ObjectID field (section 2.2.1.8.1).

[In RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Success Response Buffer] That [LongTermId] is mapped from the MessageID as specified in[MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.4.1 or 2.2.4.2, that is contained in the ObjectID field (section 2.2.1.8.1).
[in RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopLongTermIdFromId ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.8.3.
[in RopLongTermIdFromId ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol adds no additional field information to the RopLongTermIdFromId ROP failure response buffer.

[in RopIdFromLongTermId ROP] The RopIdFromLongTermId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.9) is used to obtain the Folder ID or Message ID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.4.1 or 2.2.4.2, given the LongTermID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.
[in RopIdFromLongTermId ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[in RopIdFromLongTermId ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopIdFromLongTermId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.9).

[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Request Buffer] LongTermId: Contains the LongTermID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1, to be mapped to the Folder ID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.1.1.

[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Request Buffer] LongTermId: Contains the LongTermID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1, to be mapped to the Message ID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.1.2.
[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopIdFromLongTermId ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.9).

[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Success Response Buffer] ObjectId: Contains the Folder ID or Message ID, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.1.1 or 2.2.1.2, that is mapped from the given LongTermID as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.

[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Success Response Buffer] ObjectId: The Folder ID or Message ID is a 64-bit value composed of the 16-bit replica ID (REPLID) followed by the 48-bit global counter portion of the given LongTermID.
[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopIdFromLongTermId ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.9.3.
[In RopIdFromLongTermId ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol adds no additional field information to the RopIdFromLongTermId ROP failure response buffer.

[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP] The RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.10) is used to obtain the LongTermIDs (as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1) of folders in a public folders message store that contain per-user read/unread data identified by a REPLGUID.
[in RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Request Buffer] This ROP [RopGetPerUserLongTermIds] MUST be issued against a logon that was made to a private mailbox.

[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions [DatabaseGuid] define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.10.1).
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Request Buffer] DatabaseGuid: Identifies the replica database for which the client is querying against.

[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Request Buffer] This GUID [DatabaseGuid] is obtained from the result of a RopLogon (section 2.2.1.1) issued against a public message store. For more details, see section 2.2.1.1.3.

[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields [LongTermIdCount, LongTermIds] for the success response buffer of the RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.10.2).
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Success Response Buffer] LongTermIdCount: Specifies the number of entries in the following array.
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Success Response Buffer] LongTermIdCount: This field [LongTermIdCount] can be set to zero.

[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Success Response Buffer] LongTermIds: Contains an array of LongTermID structures, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1, of folders in the public message store for which this user has cached read/unread information.
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Success Response Buffer] LongTermIds: The number of items in this array MUST be the same as the value of the LongTermIdCount field (section 2.2.1.10.2).
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.10.3.
[In RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol adds no additional field information to the RopGetPerUserLongTermIds ROP failure response buffer.

[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP] The RopGetPerUserGuid ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.11) obtains the REPLGUID of the public message store that previously provided the now cached per-user read/unread data for a specific public folder.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP] For more details about how the client uses the RopGetPerUserGuid ROP, see section 3.1.4.3.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Request Buffer] This ROP [RopGetPerUserGuid] MUST be issued against a logon that was made to a private mailbox.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopGetPerUserGuid ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.11.1).
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Request Buffer] LongTermId: Contains a LongTermID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1) that specifies the folder to query.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopGetPerUserGuid ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.11.2).
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Success Response Buffer] DatabaseGuid: Contains the REPLGUID of the last public folder database for which relevant read/unread information was cached.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopGetPerUserGuid ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.11.2.
[In RopGetPerUserGuid ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopGetPerUserGuid ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] RopReadPerUserInformation is used to obtain a set of change numbers, each of which is associated with a message that the user has read in a specific public folder.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] When this ROP is issued against a private mailbox logon, cached data for the public folder is retrieved.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] When this ROP is issued against a public folders logon, the current per-user read/unread data for the public folder is retrieved.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] The client can use this ROP in conjunction with the RopWritePerUserInformation ROP, as specified in section 2.2.1.13, to synchronize per-user read/unread data for a public folder.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP] This section [2.2.1.12] specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopReadPerUserInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.1).
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: Contains a LongTermID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1) that specifies the folder to query.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] Reserved: This value MUST be set to 0x00.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] Reserved: This value is ignored by the server.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: Identifies the offset into the stream of data.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: This value is the position of the first byte of data to be returned.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: The value MUST be greater than or equal to zero.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: The client MUST NOT set DataOffset to an arbitrary value.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: The value MUST be zero in the first RopReadPerUserInformation request ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.1).

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: If subsequent requests are necessary to retrieve all the data, then the client MUST update DataOffset by adding to it the value of the DataSize field of the previous RopReadPerUserInformation response ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.2).

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: In other words, if HasFinished equals FALSE, then DataOffset MUST be updated, as follows, after each RopReadPerUserInformation response. DataOffset = DataOffset + DataSize

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] MaxDataSize: Specifies the maximum amount of data to be returned to the client in a single RopReadPerUserInformation response ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.2).
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] MaxDataSize: The client can set MaxDataSize to zero, which indicates to the server that a default value MUST be used as the maximum size.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] MaxDataSize: When multiple RopReadPerUserInformation requests ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.1) are necessary to retrieve all of the data, the client can set MaxDataSize to a different value in each invocation of the ROP.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the success response buffer of the RopReadPerUserInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.2).
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] HasFinished: Indicates whether the last block of data is being returned.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] HasFinished: The value of this field is TRUE if the last block of data is being returned.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] HasFinished: The value of this field is FALSE if the last block of data is not being returned.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] HasFinished: This field MUST be set to TRUE if the underlying data has not changed since the last successful retrieval of per-user read/unread data, as specified in section 3.1.5.2.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] DataSize: Contains the size, in bytes, of the data being returned.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] DataSize: The value of this field MUST be less than or equal to the value of the MaxDataSize field of the request.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] DataSize: This value MUST be zero if the underlying data has not changed since the last successful retrieval of per-user read/unread data, as specified in section 3.1.5.2.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] Data: Contains the change number set (CNSET), which is serialized into a binary large object (BLOB).
[in RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Success Response Buffer] Data: The format of the BLOB is the same as that of a serialized identifier set, which is specified in [MS-OXCFXICS] section 2.2.2.4.2.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] Data: The size of the BLOB MUST be equal to the value specified in the DataSize field.

[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] Data: The client is not expected to interpret this data in any way, but simply provide it unaltered in a future sequence of invocations of RopWritePerUserInformation ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.13).
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer] The syntax of the RopReadPerUserInformation ROP failure response buffer is specified in [MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.12.3.
[In RopReadPerUserInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer] This protocol [MS-OXCSTOR] adds no additional field information to the RopReadPerUserInformation ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] RopWritePerUserInformation is used to establish the set of change numbers of messages the user has read in a specific public folder.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] When this ROP is issued against a private mailbox logon, data for the public folder is saved.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] When this ROP is issued against a public folders logon, the current per-user read/unread data for the public folder is established.

[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] The client can use this ROP in conjunction with RopReadPerUserInformation, which is specified in section 2.2.1.12, to synchronize per-user read/unread data for a public folder.
[in RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] The complete syntax of the ROP request and response buffers for this ROP is specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP] This section specifies the syntax and semantics of various fields that are not fully specified in [MS-OXCROPS].
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the request buffer of the RopWritePerUserInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.13.1).
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] FolderId: Contains a LongTermID structure ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1) that specifies the folder for which data is being saved.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] HasFinished: Indicates whether the Data field contains the last block of data to be written.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] HasFinished: If the Data field contains the last block of data to be written, this field is set to TRUE
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] HasFinished: If the Data field does not contain the last block of data to be written, this field is set to FALSE.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: Identifies the offset into the stream where this block of data is to be written.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataOffset: This value MUST be equal to the total size of the data previously written.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] DataSize: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the data to be written.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] Data: Contains the CNSET to be written.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] The CNSET is the one received in the Data field of the RopReadPerUserInformation response.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] The size of the data MUST be equal to the value specified in the DataSize field.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: Identifies which public database was the source of this data.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: The value is the REPLGUID of the last database for which relevant read/unread information was obtained.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: This GUID is obtained from the result of a RopLogon (section 2.2.1.1) issued against a public message store.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: MUST NOT be present for operations against public folders logons.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: This field MUST be present when the value of the DataOffset field is zero.
[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Request Buffer] ReplGuid: This field MUST NOT be present when DataOffset is not zero.

[In RopWritePerUserInformation ROP Response Buffer] There are no fields other than the ReturnValue field for the request buffer of the RopWritePerUserInformation ROP ([MS-OXCROPS] section 2.2.3.13.2).
[In Logon-Specific Properties] The following properties [specified in section from section 2.2.2.1 to 2.2.2.2] are available on Logon objects.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] A Logon object is obtained by issuing a RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1), and receiving a successful response.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] Some logon properties are read-only.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] Some logon properties are write-only.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] Some properties can be deleted by the client.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] Some properties are available only on public folder logons.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] Some properties are available only on private mailbox logons.

[In Logon-Specific Properties] To read any of the readable properties, the client issue a RopGetPropertiesSpecific ROP with the Logon object obtained from a successful invocation of RopLogon (section 2.2.1.1).
[In Logon-Specific Properties] To write any of the writable properties, the client issues a RopSetProperties ROP with the Logon object obtained from a successful invocation of RopLogon.
[In Logon-Specific Properties] To delete any of the deletable properties, the client issues RopDeleteProperties with the Logon object obtained from a successful invocation of RopLogon
[In Logon-Specific Properties] For more details about RopSetProperties, RopGetPropertiesSpecific, or RopDeleteProperties see [MS-OXCROPS] and [MS-OXCPRPT].
[In Private Mailbox Logon Properties] The following sections [2.2.2.1.1, 2.2.2.1.2] specify the properties that are available on a private mailbox logon.
[In Read-Only Properties] The read-only properties that are available on a private mailbox logon are specified in section 2.2.2.1.1.1 through section 2.2.2.1.1.14.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagProhibitSendQuota property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagStoreState property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagContentCount property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagMailboxOwnerEntryId property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagMailboxOwnerName property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagMessageSize property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagMessageSizeExtended property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagUserEntryId property is read-only.
[In Read-Only Properties] The PidTagCodePageId property is read-only.
[In PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit Property] The PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.685) contains the Maximum size, in bytes, the user is allowed to accumulate for a single "extended" rule.
[In PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit Property] For details of extended rules [about PidTagExtendedRuleSizeLimit], see [MS-OXORULE] section 2.2.4.
[In PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize Property] The PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.772) contains the maximum size, in kilobytes, of a message a user is allowed to submit for transmission to another user.
[In PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize Property] The PidTagMaximumSubmitMessageSize ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.770) property: An unset value or a value of -1 indicates that there is no limit.
[In PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota Property] The PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.865) contains the maximum size, in kilobytes, a user is allowed to accumulate in their mailbox, before no further mail will be delivered.
[In PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota Property] The PidTagProhibitReceiveQuota ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.863) property: An unset value or a value of -1 indicates that there is no limit.
[In PidTagProhibitSendQuota Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagProhibitSendQuota Property] The PidTagProhibitSendQuota property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.866) contains the maximum size, in kilobytes, a user is allowed to accumulate in their mailbox, before the user can no longer submit any more mail.
[In PidTagProhibitSendQuota Property] The PidTagProhibitSendQuota ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.864) property: An unset value or a value of -1 indicates that there is no limit.
[in PidTagStoreState Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagStoreState Property] The PidTagStoreState property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1019) indicates whether the mailbox has any active search folders.
[In PidTagStoreState Property] PidTagStoreState ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1017): The value FALSE indicates that the mailbox does not have active search folders.
[In PidTagContentCount Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagContentCount Property] The PidTagContentCount property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.637) contains the cumulative count of non-folder associated information (FAI) messages in the mailbox.
[In PidTagMailboxOwnerEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagMailboxOwnerEntryId Property] The PidTagMailboxOwnerEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.768) contains the EntryID in the Global Address List (GAL) of the owner of the mailbox.
[In PidTagMailboxOwnerName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagMailboxOwnerName Property] The PidTagMailboxOwnerName property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.769) contains the display name of the owner of the mailbox.
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] The PidTagMessageSize property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.787) contains the cumulative size, in bytes, of all content in the mailbox.
[In PidTagMessageSize Property] The PidTagMessageSize ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.785) property: Value is limited to 32 bits and becomes undefined if the content size exceeds four gigabytes.
[In PidTagMessageSizeExtended Property] Type: PtypInteger64 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagMessageSizeExtended Property] The PidTagMessageSizeExtended property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.788) contains the cumulative size, in bytes, of all content in the mailbox.
[In PidTagUserEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagUserEntryId Property] The PidTagUserEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1043) contains the Address book EntryID of the user logged on to the mailbox.
[In PidTagLocaleId Property] Type of PidTagLocaleId: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).

[In PidTagLocaleId Property] The PidTagLocaleId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.765) establishes the language locale for translating system-generated messages, such as delivery reports. For more details, see [MS-LCID].
[In PidTagSortLocaleId Property] Type of PidTagSortLocaleId: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagSortLocaleId Property] The PidTagSortLocaleId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1011) establishes the language locale for sorting the contents of tables. For more details, see [MS-LCID].
[In PidTagSortLocaleId Property] For additional information about this property, see section 3.2.5.1.1.
[In PidTagCodePageId Property] Type: PtypInteger32 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagCodePageId Property] The PidTagCodePageId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.627) establishes the client code page for Unicode to double-byte character set (DBCS) string conversion. For details, see [MS-UCODEREF].
[In Read/Write Properties] The read/write properties that are available on a private mailbox logon are specified in section 2.2.2.1.2.1 through section 2.2.2.1.1.13.
[In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagComment property is read/write. <13>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R6280001, MS-OXCSTOR_R6280002.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit property is readable.
[In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit property is writable.<14>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R3128, MS-OXCSTOR_R3068008.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagDisplayName property is read/write.<15>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCSTOR_R306800301, MS-OXCSTOR_R306800302.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagOutOfOfficeState property is read/write.
[In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagSentMailSvrEID property is read/write.
[In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagLocaleId property is read/write.
[In Read/Write Properties] The PidTagSortLocaleId property is read/write.
[In PidTagComment Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagComment Property] The PidTagComment property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.628) contains a mailbox comment.
[In PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit Property] The PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.659) indicates whether a transport deletes all submitted mail after transmission.
[In PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit Property] An unset value or a value of FALSE indicates that the mail is not deleted.
[In PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit Property] The client can also delete this property [PidTagDeleteAfterSubmit].
[In PidTagDisplayName Property] Type: PtypString ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagDisplayName Property] The PidTagDisplayName property ([MS-OXCFOLD] section 2.2.2.2.2.5) contains the mailbox display name.
[In PidTagOutOfOfficeState Property] Type: PtypBoolean ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
[In PidTagOutOfOfficeState Property] The PidTagOutOfOfficeState property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.846) indicates whether the user is Out of Office (OOF).

[In PidTagOutOfOfficeState Property] The PidTagOutOfOfficeState ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.910) property: The value TRUE indicates that the user is OOF, in which case the out of office rules are evaluated and executed.

[In PidTagOutOfOfficeState Property] The PidTagOutOfOfficeState ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.910) property: When the value of this property is reset, regardless of the value, the accumulated OOF history is cleared for all OOF rules.
[In PidTagOutOfOfficeState Property] For more details about rules, see [MS-OXORULE].
[In PidTagSentMailSvrEID Property] Type: PtypServerId ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1).
[In PidTagSentMailSvrEID Property] The PidTagSentMailSvrEID property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1002) contains the structure identifying the Sent Items folder.
[In PidTagSentMailSvrEID Property] The PidTagSentMailSvrEID property : An unset value indicates that the server won't move sent items to a Sent Items folder after transmission.
[in PidTagSentMailSvrEID Property] The client can also delete this property.
[In Public Folders Logon Properties] The properties that are available on a public folders logon are specified in section 2.2.2.2.1 and section 2.2.2.2.2.
[In Public Folders Logon Properties] These properties [PidTagUserEntryId, PidTagAddressBookMessageId] are read only.
[In Public Folders Logon Properties] The PidTagUserEntryId property is read-only.
[In Public Folders Logon Properties] The PidTagAddressBookMessageId property is read-only.
[In PidTagUserEntryId Property] Type: PtypBinary ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PidTagUserEntryId Property] The PidTagUserEntryId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.1043) contains the Address book EntryID of the user logged on to the public folder.
[in PidTagUserEntryId Property] This property is also available on private mailbox logon (section 2.2.2.1.1.11).
[In PidTagAddressBookMessageId Property] Type: PtypInteger64 ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1)

[In PidTagAddressBookMessageId Property] The PidTagAddressBookMessageId property ([MS-OXPROPS] section 2.542) contains the short-term MID of the first message in the local site's offline address book public folder, if it exists and has a local replica.

[in PidTagAddressBookMessageId Property] The property [PidTagAddressBookMessageId] MUST have an error value of ecNotFound (0x8004010F) if there is no local site offline address book public folder, the server can't open the folder, the server can't access the message, or there is no local replica of the folder.
[In Abstract Data Model] This section describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[In Abstract Data Model] The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This document does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this document.

[In Abstract Data Model] cache of REPLID / REPLGUID mapping: The client maintains a cache of the mapping between REPLIDs and REPLGUIDs used for Folder IDs or Message IDs, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.2.1.1 or 2.2.1.2 and LongTermIDs, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.2.1.3.1.
[In Abstract Data Model] cache of per-user data: The client maintains a cache of per-user data currently stored in the private message store.
[In Abstract Data Model] This [The client maintains a cache of per user data currently stored in the private message store.] enables the client to sync per-user data only when a change has been made.

[In Logging on to a Store] When the user opens the client application, the client establishes a Session Context with the server by using the EcDoConnectEx method, as is specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.1.

[In Logging on to a Store] When the user opens the client application, the client establishes a Session Context with the server by using the Connect request type<16>, as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 2.2.4.1.
[In Logging on to a Store] Once the client has successfully connected to the server, the client logs on to the message store by sending a RopLogon request (section 2.2.1.1.1).
[In Logging on to a Store] When the client sends RopLogon, the client MUST specify a LogonID to be used in the ROP request buffer.
[in Logging on to a Store] For more details about logging on and the LogonID, see [MS-OXCROPS] section 3.1.4.2
